description: Overall, it's a great replacement for Origin. It is very similar so feel like at home. Some features a better then origin some latest Origin features are missing, but if you need a general plotting app it is the best of all open-source ones.

Toolbar has extremely small icons (barely readable) and can not be changed. There are NO row parameters, can not adjust row height for example. This is nothing like the images displayed on their website. Just from the lack of readability stand point the app is not much use as it. I sure it is a great app but these type issue make not worth the time and effort to download.

I only used this app for a few minutes so far, but from what I've seen this app has a whole lot of potential. This would be an excellent app for plotting CNC drilling programs, like hole patterns for something like shell and tube heat exchangers, radiators, etc... I will use this application, for many different things I'm sure. Great application.
It is amazing, very similar to Origin.
when the full version will be released on Ubuntu 20.04 ?

I have done enough Stats to know this can be useful for scientific stuff but like most Graph software it starts from a point of some complexity. I moved from Open / Libre Office for a lack of basics but all I want is one hundred years plotted against numerical values 1 to 20 and some flexibility in colours and labelling. Qit makes the years into 1,800 and no obvious way to change it? There are plenty of other things too and agree about the icon comments. Can't knock that it is free and for physicists and mathematicians it is probably great but if it don't do the basics then it is going to be ugly to do the complicated?
Aplicación bastante completa, tiene muchas funciones para trabajar set de datos científicos. Lo único que no encuentro es la función Average Multiple Curves en el menú Analysis.
summary: Muy buena aplicación, similar a OriginLab 8.0
